document_data.name: Longspear
document_data.mainbody: '''Longspears''' were a variety of spears noted for having a greater length and weight than the average [[spear]].
document_data.Description: The length of the shaft for a longspear varied, though was generally in the range of {{SIrange|10|13|ft|long=yes}}, and weighed {{SIrange|8|9|lb|k}}.{{Cite dragon/331/The Point of Pole Arms|23}} another member of the spear family of [[pole arm]]s that had considerably longer shafts.
document_data.Weaponology: Due to their considerable size and length, longspears were ineffective throwing weapons and required both hands to wield properly.
document_data.Notable Longspears:
* ''[[Death spear]]s'', enchanted longspears that were infused with [[negative energy]] and used by elite [[drow]] warriors.
* ''[[Rod of surprises]]'', an enchanted ''+1 [[rod]]'' that could transform in a variety of weapons, including the longspear.
* ''[[Spear of Morgur]]'', an enchanted longspear originating from the ruins of [[Illusk]].<ref>

Notable Users.Races & Sentient Creatures:
* For [[Merrow (ogre)|aquatic ogre]]s the longspear was often their weapon of choice.
* [[Coal golem]]s were typically armed by their creators with oversized metal longspears that glowed red from the heat of their bodies.{{Cite web/Monster Mayhem/Coal Golem}}
* Among [[cyclops]]es, those in the [[Shining South]] region often wielded longspears.<ref>
* [[Firenewt]]s were sometimes known to fight with longspears.
* For [[fossergrim]] a longspear was typically the weapon of choice for close-quarters combat.
* [[Lamia noble]]s sometimes fought with enchanted longspears.
* Among [[ogre]]s a longspear was common weapon.
* [[Orc]]s were often known to wield longspears.
Notable Users.Religions: * Longspears were the [[favored weapon]] of a variety of deities, including [[Sebek]] and [[Sseth]].<ref>
